Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay at the Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: ADelCol
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Roosevelt this past weekend and it was a great experience. First off, I had the cutest little room - very cozy - with a great view of the city. The staff was great and went above-and-beyond the call of duty to make it a great experience for me (despite the fact that it was a very busy convention weekend). My only complaints are that the fitness room is very small as well as the business centre - but everything else is great. I look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and amenities”
Reviews.Author: Laura C
Reviews.Content: We'd definitely stay here again. The location can't be beat--right in the heart of the city so you can walk or catch public transit anywhere you'd like to go. The rooms are clean and nice, beds very comfy (though only double or king-sized beds are available, no queens), and my daughter took full advantage of the nice 24-hour fitness center. We loved the fact that the windows opened so we could get fresh air! Our 16th floor room was quiet and the staff was friendly and helpful. We also loved having Von's RoastHouse restaurant and bar available on site. You can pop in for a good $3.50 house martini after a long day of sight-seeing, and the 5-6 pm happy hour is an incredible bargain. You can order off a limited food menu for half the usual price--dishes like salmon and chips for $3.25!--so a nice dinner for two with a couple of drinks can be had for under $30 between 5 and 6 p.m., allowing you to save your money for a more extravagant lunch at Elliott's Oyster House or the Blue Acre or any of the other terrific restaurants nearby. I'd highly recommend the Roosevelt.

Reviews.Title: “Fair at best”
Reviews.Author: Sonics
Reviews.Content: Not totally impressed.First time to this hotel, and the last time. My queen room was tiny to begin with, add the really poor water pressure with the shower nozzle being in a great place for small people, outdated room furnishings and lobby that looks tired. Customer service is a question mark, as I overheard a problem with one guest at check-in and to see him return to front desk complaining about he was given a dirty room and the front desk girl acting like she did not care. I should not be surprised as I when I checked in the bellman just glared at me, like he was security or something-I thought "what, never seen anyone in a suit before?" by the way, checked into the other Coast - the Paramount..what a difference-that is a hotel. This one can learn a lot from them. One thing this hotel has is Von- the restaurant. Great food, service, and nice portions. This is the only reason why this hotel gets a "3" from me. Without the food service, its a "2". Too bad nice location, but wasted on service and decor.

Reviews.Title: “Supurb Location!”
Reviews.Author: TheLeonard
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here recently for our first time. Check-in was easy, and its location is the best. Right in the middle of downtown Seattle's business, shopping and dining area. You can walk to most attractions from here. Great little bar attatched to the premises also. We got a very nice corner room on the 8th floor. It appeared to be one of the larger rooms, according to the floor diagram. The bed itself was very comfortable. If your a light sleeper, request a higher floor due to the early morning street activity. I had ear plugs, and my wife sleeps soundly, so it wasn't much of an issue for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: shanne
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights with a couple friends. Easy walk to Pike Place and lots of shopping and restaurants nearby. Only complaint I would have was that our room smelled of bleach (at least we knew it was clean!) and we found the heater very noisy, especially at night. But overall a good hotel with friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Roberta M
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel and very friendly & helpful staff. Comfortable, clean and quiet room. Excellent dinner in the restaurant. Location can't be beat - lots in walking distance and close to Monorail to get to Space Needle, Science Center & Music Experience. Short walk to Pike Place Market. All sorts of shopping and restaurants in walking distance. Outdated information in hotel guest guide - check with the friendly consierge; incorrect TV listings so use their Channel 2 for correct information. Overall experience was excellent and we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “"Perfectly Perfect"!”
Reviews.Author: KDSPKTRAVELS
Reviews.Content: A very comfortable, clean, and quite hotel situated in the heart of downtown Seattle. We will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Our Experience”
Reviews.Author: DJT1018
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went for a getaway, just the two of us. We fell in love with this hotel. Everything was wonderful, the staff was great. We felt very welcomed. We were able to walk to everything we wanted to see. The location is great with lots of restaurants in walking distance. This hotel is beautifully updated. We look forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Staying at the Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: Tracy F
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of Seattle, the Roosevelt is in easy walking distance of good restaurants, shopping, and the Convention Center. The staff was welcoming, friendly, and helpful. The elevator requires the room key, which was a nice safety feature I appreciated. While the room I stayed in was smaller, it was clean, and the bed was very comfortable. Great shower! I would recommend this hotel to some of the newer giants that surround it.

Reviews.Title: “Classic”
Reviews.Author: Randy C
Reviews.Content: Visit the Roosevelt yearly, always a lovely stay. Great location in Seattle, always walking distance from wherever I need to be, whether it's the convention center or Pike's Place. Always recommend to friends/coworkers when they need an affordable upscale hotel to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Roosevelt Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: Sue D
Reviews.Content: My daughters and I had a girls getaway in Seattle and stayed here. The location is just great. Right in the city, walking distance to good restaurants, Pike Street Market and great shopping. The hotel staff was remarkable, the room quiet, comfortable and elegant. I look forward to another visit, this time with my husband,

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WendaK
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel which has been updated. The updates are lovely. Our room was large with a separate entrance area with flowers and closet space. The room it self looked out at the city. Beautiful bed and furnishings. Check in was quick. One just has to remember to use your room key to use the elevator. There was breakfast in the morning in the bar which was very adequate. An extremely nice property!

Reviews.Title: “The Roosevelt is one of my new Seattle favorites”
Reviews.Author: tacomarick
Reviews.Content: So we stayed here thanks to a Groupon getaway. Pretty much the same as one of the hotels stay and dine packages I think. I was pretty excited after seeing the great reviews on here. The Roosevelt delivered. First of all this place has the best location out of any of the Seattle Hotels I have stayed at. We did quite a bit and everything was within 2 blocks. It was great! We used the Valet with no issues. I will note most valets at least offer to help with bags and such which these ones didn’t. Not an issue for me, as I usually just get my own anyway. Check in was very friendly. We arrived prior to check in but was glad that a room was available. The check in staff even gave me a choice of several floors which I thought was a nice touch. We took the highest floor available. We had a deluxe King Junior suite. Not a great view, but we were up high so that was nice. Overall, I was very impressed with the room. Large living area with sofa and desk, bed was comfortable, and a flat screen TV that rotates towards living area or the bed. The only downside to this hotel and their rooms are the bathrooms. Although I don’t book a room based on bathroom, I’m not going to lie, I was not impressed. Very small, the shower had a hard wide spray (not adjustable). I’m a tall guy so I am used to not having a spacious shower. Don’t look up at the vent above the shower, could be dust and stuff there from the 1980’s. It was gross looking. Anyway, as I stated, I don’t book on the bathroom, but for you picky travelers, I just wanted to note it. I am guessing had we upgraded to a Jacuzzi suite it would have been bigger. The room also had a small coffee pot and coffee and a separate sink area which is nice. This room is great, especially if you are going to spend any time in there. Many Seattle hotel rooms, you would get cabin fever due to small rooms, well, not the case here. We had lunch at the attached Bar & restaurant called Vons. It was incredible. They had great food and a great beer and liquor selection. I was impressed and Vons is a must do in Seattle now. We used the dining credit for Il Fornaio which is right across the street in the mall. It was good and I will write separate reviews on the dining. Checkout was easy and quick and didn’t have to wait too long to pick up the car. As a side note, I did not experience slow elevators as other stated. Keep in mind, this is an old historic hotel and there are only two elevators, so not much can be done about that. Get a low floor if you are that picky about it. I was really impressed overall and the Roosevelt is one of our new favorite Seattle Hotels. It has great location, spacious room, friendly staff, and worked out great for us. I do a decent amount of traveling and also do some travel blogging. I can’t wait to share our experience with everyone. I hope they keep up with some of the specials such as Groupon and the Stay and Dine. Great opportunity for new fans like us! One side note: hey Brandon, I would love to see the Roosevelt on Facebook and Twitter. I didn’t see anything except West coast hotels on Facebook. I also really like the emails you get ahead of time. No need to confirm when they remind you of the upcoming stay as well as a thank you email after you leave. Just a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Basic room but great location”
Reviews.Author: 65Mustang-PoulsboWA
Reviews.Content: We like the Roosevelt for its great location. Very close to Paramount Theater...steps from shopping and good eateries. Bed was very comfortable and price point for rooms was good. On the low score side is really poor water pressure, dated room finishings, and no mini bar or hotel consssion stand for sundries and/or snacks&water.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Seattle Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lhabr56
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at the Roosevelt in as many years. We stayed there initially bcause it was one of the hotels who offered special rates to those attending the Northwest Flower & Garden Show. When we stayed last year my opinion was that it was just an ok place to stay. The room was quite small, but very clean. This year we booked there again for the flower show. When we arrived, we were quite surprised at the room. It had obviously been re-done recently. It was a mini-suite of sorts, with a sitting area with a sofa, chair, table & also a desk.The large flat screen television was set up to swivel towards either the sitting or sleeping rooms. Internet was free, and was easy to access. We had a king size bed, even though we had only booked a queen. The bathroom was well stocked with all essentials, although it was a bit small. One of the best things about this hotel is where it is located. It is just across & down 1/2 a block from the convention center. It is within easy walking distance from shopping, dining & the always entertaining Pike Place Market. Parking is a little on the steep side, but that is the case in every parking lot in the city. There is also a restaurant/bar "Vons" connected to the hotel & the food there is very good & well priced. We will choose this hotel over the larger, pricier big names anytime we visit Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great room in the heart of the shopping district”
Reviews.Author: CathyJean10
Reviews.Content: This hotel fit the bill for us. Once parked, it's an easy walk (or dash through the rain) to stores, restaurants, theatres. We were here to meet friends for dinner and shop, but I'd stay here again to attend something at the Paramount Theatre, down the street. Our queen room was small but nicely updated with comfy bed, nice lighting and a tiny, very clean bathroom. It also had a working thermostat, which is a big plus in my books! The only downside was the cost of parking ($36 for a little over 24 hours), but for a room in the city I guess that's to be expected. Overall a nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ExBritSeattle
Reviews.Content: Our stay was part of a "night on the town" package that included valet parking and a voucher towards a meal at nearby restaurants and as such represented good value - the hotel frequently has such offers on their website. Access is easy and the valet parking convenient. Check-in was very smooth and professional. For an older, downtown, hotel our room wasn't a bad size with separate sitting area apart from the bed space. Decor was generally in good order and both the bed and linens were of high quality. The room was very quiet even though we were only steps from the elevator, and there was no street noise at all. Slight niggles: some nooks and crannies suggested that cleaning hadn't been quite as thorough as one might hope - dust on top of a few less commonly seen horizontal surfaces. The tea/coffee service was incomplete with several choices of sugar and sweetener but no creamer. The bar was packed to the gills on a Saturday evening and we had no chance to try their martini selection. The food vouchers did not include the hotels own restaurant, so we had breakfast elsewhere and had no chance to try the kitchen. All in all a pleasant and comfortable stay, with a particular nod to helpful and professional desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: LocalGirl55
Reviews.Content: We had a king room, not much deluxe about it. It was small, as expected, but comfortable. Nice central location for walking just about anywhere downtown. We found a a great little tapas place a few blocks away across the freeway. Room was clean, bed very comfortable, room pretty quiet. We would stay there again, but would spring for a larger room if for the two of us. Room is spacious for one. Tub not very big, but quite deep. Only complaint is that the handles on the sink are difficult to use if your hands are slippery; there is nothing to grab on to, just a little "c" shape that your finger fits into.

Reviews.Title: “Dated but not horrible”
Reviews.Author: dougers79
Reviews.Content: The location downtown is very ideal. Very close to just about everything which is great! The room and lobby are a bit dated. I thought the parking was very high for the weekend. If you are looking for a clean room that is central and you are not driving...totally reccomend this hotel. The room itslef was very reasonable. I found the bed to be comfortable and again...you cannot beat the location!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sKat85
Reviews.Content: The decor was pretty nice. The bed was really comfortable, it was nice & soft and cushy. Everything was very clean. The staff people we very friendly. The only downside was the heating system which we had to have turned on since it was January in Seattle and very cold. The heater basically sounded like there were a bunch of very loud fans on. Other than that it was a nice place to stay and it is close to a lot of fun places to go and restaurants to eat at.

Reviews.Title: “Roosevelt Seattle”
Reviews.Author: northsantiam
Reviews.Content: What a nice place, Room was spotless, everything looked and smelled clean. Staff was pleasant and eager to help. Price was great for a downtown hotel, even got free valet parking when we booked online through "bookit.com". Location was great for dinning, shopping or other entertainment. Would easily recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent anniversary!”
Reviews.Author: lindux
Reviews.Content: This previous weekend my husband and I stayed at the Roosevelt Hotel In Seattle. We have traveled extensively throughout the world and thought you might be interested in our observations. We arrived Saturday Morning while a heavy wind and light rain made the area not so scenic nor enjoyable. The valet rushed into the rain to facilitate our baggage and park the car. He was extremely friendly and wanting to be of assistance. We could barely get into the lobby and the Concierge immediately made us feel comfortable with small talk as we were waiting inline to be checked in. At the Front Desk Peter Schmidt handled the many questions of incoming guests with humor and expertise. When it came to our turn I explained we were there for a wedding anniversary and he suggested a Jacuzzi room on 15th floor. We arrived at room 1508 and it was all as he had described. The views to Elliot Bay from the West window, Space Needle from the North were spectacular. The bed was made as to appear comfortable for arrivals and the Jacuzzi and bathrooms were adequately staffed with supplies. The room was immaculate clean, as if more of a model Hotel room rather then one in use. How to grade Excellence? Next trip to Seattle we will be staying at the Roosevelt!

Reviews.Title: “staff are womderful at the roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: cathryn s
Reviews.Content: we had a wonderful stay in a perfect location with wonderful staff.the hotel was very clean and the room spacious.the hotel was centraley located and would be great for familys as there are two movie cinamas and a very large arcade right next door and two affordable food courts one next door and one two blocks away at the monerail station.we had a great time and would deffenitley stay again

Reviews.Title: “First class in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Velvet21
Reviews.Content: We spent New Year's Eve at the Roosevelt in downtown Seattle. The staff there is always friendly and accommodating. We were in Von's restaurant (attached to the hotel) at midnight. Our room was lovely and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “great stay at the Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: dhalcrow
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt is a modernized older hotel with 1940's character. The hotel is ideally located in downtown Seattle about 3 minutes off the I-5 freeway and about the same to get back on. Nice decor, amply sized junior suite, parking available (included in our special rate), and staff exceptionally courteous and I am sure helpful should assistance be requested.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: RobinSanJose
Reviews.Content: After looking at various other hotels that were fairly pricey, I was very pleased with The Roosevelt. Yes, the bathrooms are small, but I don't go on trips to stay in the rooms. In fact, the beds are very comfortable and they supply you robes. Staff is very friendly and helpful, but best of all, it's the location! Great area and walking distance to Pike's Market. The lobby is beautifully decorated and I highly recommend to take advantage of their parking price included in hotel stay price. So worth it! I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here New Year's Eve”
Reviews.Author: Travelinggirl1968
Reviews.Content: My husband, 11 year old daughter, and myself checked in at 3 p.m....one hour earlier than posted 4 p.m. check-in, and they did not question it at all! They upgraded us to a lovely room overlooking downtown, with glimpses of the water (Puget Sound). The room was very well appointed, with two double beds in one area, and separated by a computer desk was a lounge area where there was a couch and flat screen TV. The channel options on the TV were excellent! The only real complaint I had, was that we had booked online, choosing a package where we would receive a $40 voucher to one of four restaurants. Since it was NYE, I made dinner reservations at one of the restaurants listed, but upon receiving my voucher at check-in, found out that the restaurant we chose to make reservations at, were no longer taking them...so we were in for an expensive dinner! Manager just seemed to shrug it off. And one more thing to mention, was the security...it was excellent, with all the elevators needing a room keycard to access the floors.

Reviews.Title: “just before christmas”
Reviews.Author: 7patti_vancouver_bc7
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Roosevelt a few days before Christmas. Went to see a Christmas Carol at the ACT Theatre which is about a 3 min walk from the hotel, great play! Rooms were clean and very spacious, bathrooms small but clean. Great place for a family! Von's has great happy hour food specials and their $3.50 martinis are fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Roosevelt Hotel - A must stay !”
Reviews.Author: topeak
Reviews.Content: We stayed with friends including our young children with the intentions of watching Space Needle Fireworks on New Years. A year ago we had a poor experience at another local hotel but thought we would try it again. Our rooms were purchase on Groupon so didn't have alot of expectation. Let me tell you, this Hotel understands the importance of customer service! The Roosevelt staff were friendly on every level. Even during a busy time such as New Years, everything was very well organized and timely. I could write a bunch more but realy hit the jackpot on excellent service this time around. I usually do not repond to this sort of system response but considering the amount of travel I get to do, this is one of 2 hotels I want to rave about !

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, good location”
Reviews.Author: Alwayscranky
Reviews.Content: Stay was okay at best. Rooms are super small and can get claustrophobic when trying to escape the rain. Wireless internet was terrible in the rooms, barely could stay connected. Room thermostat didn't work right, would either keep blowing hit air non-stop or would shut off completely so we would be either sweating or freezing. Probably will stay somewhere else next time we visit Seattle...in fact we are. Next time in February we will be at the Hyatt. Got a deal on Expedia,$103 including parking. I would refuse to pay anymore than that.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: S0Cal2
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel located in the most perfect area of Seattle. Staff is excellent, room was great and once again the location was perfect. I would definitely stay here again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, great room.”
Reviews.Author: WestcoastMom
Reviews.Content: Spent Dec 24 to 27 in a Jacuzzi King corner room. Very spacious room, fantastic two person jacuzzi soaker tub. Free no hassle in room wifi, welcoming staff, no issues whatsoever. Booked thru Expedia and all purchase details were honored at check-in. Cannot beat the location, right smack in the middle of downtown shopping, movies theatres in same block as hotel, Starbucks across the street and six very short blocks to Pike Place Market. Have stayed at a variety of Seattle hotels in the past but will look no further than the Roosevelt next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal and excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: judymc1
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent deal through TravelZoo for our stay at The Roosevelt but their location and attention to service made it an even better deal. The Roosevelt is in an excellent location downtown, near the bus tunnel and walkable to shopping, restaurants, and the Market. They were very flexible about extending the parking hours, which saved us money. Free computer access is in the lobby and business center. The lobby is a pleasant place to rest between shops. Even without a deal their prices are very reasonable for downtown.

Reviews.Title: “safe downtown”
Reviews.Author: Mike N
Reviews.Content: So!!!! if your looking for a well run conveniently located(accross street from excellent shopping and 10 minute walk to pike market) very safe environment, this is the place..... clean friendly comfort. The only issue we had was the parking(it's a long story). I hate to write such a good review as the price might go up for our next trip there but they earned it. Remember to sort out your parking first.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location in Stately Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CoupleGetaways
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt Hotel in downtown Seattle is a classic retreat in the heart of the city. My husband and I recently enjoyed our couple getaway at this stately hotel, as part of the Ultimate Shopping Package. First off, the location is amazing. The Roosevelt is located on the corner of 7th and Pine. It’s across the street from the Convention Center and Pacific Place. It’s also near Nordstrom, City Centre, and Macy’s. It’s easy walking distance to Westlake Center. The Roosevelt is surrounded by restaurants and shops of every variety. True to Seattle, it is within one mile of at least 8 Starbucks. It really is in the heart of Downtown Seattle. One thing I love about older hotels is they aren’t all exactly the same. Each room is unique. During our stay, we had a deluxe king room, #1103. I am almost sure other rooms in this same category have different layouts. Ours was nearly a suite…suite-ette? Yeah, I think that’s what I’ll call it. Upon entering, you’ll notice a wet bar to the right. It has a small sink with only cold water, a counter top and the coffee amenities. To the right of that is the living area. There was a sofa that folded out to a sleeper, complete with sheets and blankets. There was a coffee table, a small writing desk with chair, an end table and an armchair. When the bed was folded out, it was a bit cramped, but when it was folded up, there was plenty of room. For more information, go to my user name with *dot* org on the end.

Reviews.Title: “There's good news and bad news”
Reviews.Author: RKITEC
Reviews.Content: The good news about the Roosevelt is that it's in a great location, a block from the Convention Center and in the midst of downtown shopping and restaurants. The lobby is also quite attractive and welcoming. The good news ended at the door to our room - we had reserved a "deluxe queen," but the bed was actually a double bed (we stayed in queen-sized beds the next four nights elsewhere and I can assure you that this was NOT a queen-size bed). The water pressure in the shower was non-existent and one had to hold up the little knob on the tub faucet for quite a while to get any water to dribble out of the shower. All in all, the room was pretty shabby for a "deluxe queen." Breakfast is available in the bar of the attached Vonn's Restaurant for $9.95; however, for $9.95 you get toast and a small selection of other breakfast breads, maybe some cold cereal and coffee. We went across the street to "nyc" and Starbucks. The hotel staff was not particularly welcoming, either. If I was by myself, I might stay there again, due to the location, but my wife and I will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Return to the Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: Hover-lover
Reviews.Content: The combination of location, consistent good service, and comfortable rooms make this hotel a good choice!! We've stayed there several times and the location makes car rental unnecessary. The people are nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location for a shopping day and girl's night out.”
Reviews.Author: giggle18
Reviews.Content: Great location for a shopping day and girl’s night out, everything is within walking distance and easy to get to. Check in was easy, the gentleman at the front desk was not cold but not overly friendly. The room was on the smaller side but clean. Large flat screen TV and toiletries were nice. The only problem we encountered was my fault but not handled in the right manor. I left an item in the room and called shortly after we checked out, and was told that it was not found. I know exactly where I left it and even drove back to the hotel to ask again, nothing turned up. All in all a nice stay, although I would look for an online deal otherwise I feel the price is a bit steep.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant older hotel”
Reviews.Author: mezaco
Reviews.Content: Totally pleased with the Roosevelt. Needed to be near the convention center and downtown attractions so the location was great. Yes, it's an older property but did not notice any sort of shabbiness in my room or the property itself. The rate was great, the cheapest available in downtown Seattle. Comfortable room, cozy, but not as tiny as some people had me believe. I believe the rooms vary in size but ours was fine, comfy bedding, flat screen TV, free Wi-Fi in the room, etc. The bathrooms are tiny but adequate. We paid for 1 shared queen bed on Expedia but actually wanted 2 separate beds and upon arrival were given a room with 2 doubles no problem. Staff helpfully allowed us to keep our car on site until well into the evening of our departure day (long after we checked out), thus we avoided having to move it or pay more. Staff were very nice. Only dining option is a bar attached to the hotel, which didn't appeal, but as we were centrally located that was okay as we found others nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Class”
Reviews.Author: Pinefinch98257
Reviews.Content: I stay in Seattle about once a year for a conference, and I always stay at the Roosevelt. It's a block from the WA State Convention Center, where the conference happens. Nearby are restaurants, a movie theater, shopping, and Pike Place Market. Location is great, but mainly I like the Roosevelt for its old-school vibe and relative affordability. This is an old, solid building that's been kept up. The carpets and rooms are clean, the bathrooms are updated, the doors close with a satisfying "snick," and the lobby is cozy. Booking ahead, I paid about $135/night, which included parking - a very expensive perk! I've also stayed at the Mayflower, which was lovely, but about $50/night more; and I've stayed at the Travelodge by the Space Needle, which was a lot less, but depressing. This last time, we asked for a fridge, which we got - for an extra $10/night. Hey ho.

Reviews.Title: “The location is good, the room wasn't”
Reviews.Author: Karin_B_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for night because a friend of us got a "good deal" with groupon. Would not have chosen this hotel otherwise. We had one of the bigger rooms for 4 persons, which meant a nice king size bed and a sofa bed. The sofa bed was absolutely NOT comfortable, had a hard time sleeping. It may be ok for kids, but we could feel all the springs and the was a plastic cover around the mattress that made lots of sound every time we moved. Not cool. I can't believe the prices they charge for their rooms, since it's a actually just a normal 3 star hotel. Not more or less. The rooms could need some refurbishment to motivate the prices. Wouldn't stay there again,since there are other hotels which offer more charm at a better price. The location is perfect, though, for most tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised: exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: joan1231
Reviews.Content: After reading several really bad reviews, I bit the bullet and booked anyway. I have to say, kindness/service may be a season thing w/ this hotel, b/c I stayed during November, and service was incredible. Front desk, concierge, housekeeping, was all spectacular. Granted, one could tell there was hard feelings about booking through a travel website instead of directly through them, but that was just a small thing. It's location - PERFECT. Close to shopping, dining, and all the major tourist attractions. The room - although not fancy, it served it's purpose very well. I would highly recommend this hotel if it is not in their busy season, which appears to be late fall or winter.

Reviews.Title: “OK stay”
Reviews.Author: London.dreaming
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roosevelt on Saturday night - a little getaway for the weekend. It was OK. Clean, friendly front desk staff. Had a small wrinkle though. Cleaning staff were in our room (while we were out) before we checked out. Not sure why as our suitcases etc were in the middle of the room....maybe translation mix up. It was a little unsettling. On the positive side - you couldn't find a more convenient hotel in downtown Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great room .. Great service and a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Alazzo
Reviews.Content: We visited Seattle for a three night stay and had the great fortune to book a room at the Roosevelt Hotel at a great price. We had a small glitch with our reservation when we checked in, the problem was fixed and the front desk was very caring and concerned. Great service rises when there are problems. It is a lovely older property that is run by Coast Hotels and it is in a perfect location. We were assigned a corner room on the 11th floor overlooking the city and Pine Street. My wife could see the department stores, malls and great shopping from our window, so the location was very convenient for her to just step outside and go shopping. There were many nice places to eat and Von's which has an entrance inside the hotel was a nice place to get drinks and a small meal for a reasonable price on our first night there. Just across the road was a Mall that had a variety of stores and a whole floor of restaurants. The Market and the monorail stop are down and I mean down the road. You can walk to most of the Seattle attractions and the monorail ($2.00 one way) takes you to the Space Needle and park about a mile away. The “Duck Boat” Tours has a stop right outside the monorail stop and it is a great way to see the city and get on the water. We planned our walk so we stopped for the tour and then walked down to the Market. The walk back up the hill is, as others have mention a little trek but you can always call a cab and for $5.00 be back at the hotel. We did both. The oversized corner room was well appointed, a king size very comfortable bed, sitting area, huge flat screen TV, free WiFi, desk, ottomans, a smaller bath with older but very clean functional fixtures and another bath with the one of the largest jacuzzi baths I have ever seen. It was put to good use and it worked great. We had more than enough towels and bath accessories. There was plenty of closet and storage space. Bathrobes and slippers were hanging in the closet and they provided bottled water. ($4.00) We did not use the fitness center and I am not sure if they have a pool. The front desk and concierge were very helpful both in answering any questions we had or just getting us a cab. We very much enjoyed our stay at the Roosevelt Hotel and plan to return again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Walking in downtown Seattle has a price”
Reviews.Author: JoaquinB
Reviews.Content: ... and its not a cheap one! The Roosevelt hotel is located in downtown Seattle, which means you can walk from here to practically every major landmark in this beautiful Pacific Northwest city. Whether you want to walk to Pike place or to the Space Needle, the Roosevelt Hotel is a great option. Elegant foyer, cozy rooms just across the street from Barns and Noble, which, if you come from abroad, is always a treat! The only think lacking here is a restaurant of its own that holds up to the reputation of the hotel. The pub around the corner, which is accessible through the lobby, is ok, but just ok. Filled with Americana and levers from beer barrels, the place offers a small variety of items for breakfast. Having lunch there, is just not worthy; go to the Market and have sea food, lots of it! Expensive but I didn't spend a single dime on public transportation or gas. Just parked in and walked around. Location, location, location.

Reviews.Title: “Trip to Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth R
Reviews.Content: I planned a last minute trip to Seattle and was looking for a decently priced hotel in a central location downtown. The Roosevelt was great! I booked through Orbitz and got a great deal. The hotel is in an awesome location in downtown. It's really central, so getting around was easy. I took the Light Rail from the airport for $2.50 and it left me two blocks from the hotel. It's not the fanciest hotel, the rooms are a little small, but comfortable and the staff was helpful and efficient. The bed and pillows were very comfortable, and I requested a higher level room so I had a good view. I'd definitely recommend this place to others.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: james b
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely room looking down to the pike street market area; we took the train and found it was easy to walk to some exceptional restaurants. One short bus ride to Broadway for breakfast, and a very short cab ride to the station. The staff was helpful yet low-key. A geat visit and we would stay there again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tim L
Reviews.Content: Nice location in downtown Seattle , walk to almost everywhere , The room was excellent , the bed was the best , flat screen tv with adjustable bracket to pull out , 2 different windows to watch downtown people and a great rate from Expedia..

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: Jessica M
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights here on our tour of the Northwest. Great location, nice room, fair view, walking distance to everything downtown. Parking was $26/night, non-valet. Would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time In Seattle”
Reviews.Author: BRMYKM
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt was a wonderful. My wife and I were visiting from Atlanta (go Falcons) and the hotel management, as well as the staff, were very accommodating. For an older hotel, it was in GREAT shape. I greatly appreciate the cordial conversation from the front desk crew. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money!”
Reviews.Author: Michele G
Reviews.Content: I made my reservation online for my 28th wedding anniversary. I was very impressed with the followup email offering assistance with area attractions and dining reservations. I email my questions and after two days got no response. I then called THREE times and tried to speak to the concierge who I was told was too busy making reservations for whale tours and carrying bags. I understand the hotel is small but I was not offered to leave a message or to get assistance from any other employee. I was told to call back. Finally I did talk to someone and they were very frazzled and seemed annoyed that I was asking for help but did give some info on area dining. Upon arrival at the hotel I was informed that there had been an incident the night prior that rendered the room that I had rented uninhabitable and all the other comparable rooms were occupied. No one bothered to call me to see if I would still want to stay at the hotel. We were downgraded to a regular room which was fine but only offered a $10 discount on the room. I felt a free stay was definitely in order but at this late date ( it was 8:00 at night by the time we checked in because we went straight to a baseball game upon arriving in Seattle), we didn't have much of a chance to make a change. To top it all off we left our contact information upon check out for the manager and never heard a word. I would have to say that my impression of Coast hotels has definitely been altered and I would be very hesitant to stay with them in the future at other locations. Basically, the hotel is a disaster.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely come back - great location”
Reviews.Author: melonfawn
Reviews.Content: Everything is spotlessly clean, the staff are friendly and efficient, and the beds are comfy as anything. My only tip would be to skip breakfast at the hotel as it is really bad, and go to one of the many restaurants around the hotel. Great location, close to shops, a few blocks from Pike Place Market. Definitely reccommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bcgirls
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great place to stay. It was located about 6 blocks down to the pike market. About a mile to the Space Needle. There was 2 movie theaters within about a 2 block radius. I went this August 2011 and stayed 2 nights here. The hotel room wasn't the biggest but for what my daughter and I needed it was good. They had valet parking so didn't have to worry about driving around Seattle. Parked it for 2 days and spent the time walking around, it was just a perfect position for us and what we wanted to see.I had asked the front desk clerk on my first night there for a wake up call the next morning but didn't receive it ,he must've been busy but was glad I wasn't going to a meeting or anything important, I just didn't want to waste the day away by sleeping in. I did complain the next morning and had a very apologetic front desk clerk. They were very helpful when we wanted directions or what restaurants were good to go to etc. I would stay here again if I was staying in the city.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT SERVICE and GREAT HOTEL for the Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: Flight184
Reviews.Content: This convention was on my own bucks. Couldn't afford the Hyatt, Sheraton, etc. and am not an status member. Booked the Roosevelt on Priceline and got a great rate for the convention. When I checked in Caleb and Patrick at the fron desk get me a great room and made me feel like I was a VIP traveler. Simple things helping me with the business center and just the overall "can do" attitude blew my expectations away. If you are going to the convention center and need a great value, this is the place. Great restaurant with good food and good value, too.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: PrettyTravelVixen
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my company, I really did not have a say so. This hotel was okay. The bathrooms was small and vintage. The hotel was up to date. Nice flat screen but no channels to watch but the news. I love the location of the hotel, right in the heart of downtown Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Will definetly use again.”
Reviews.Author: cmcg211
Reviews.Content: I was at the Roosevelt for a 1 night stay August 30 with my 10 year old and my Mother. We booked a 2 bed double on the hotel website for the same price as quoted by Priceline and other hotel resellers. Our room was a good size with two windows over looking the corner of 7th and Pine. The staff was friendly and the service was quick and efficient. The Valet was OUTSTANDING, I had called the parking lots next to the Hotel and they wanted $2 to $5 more for 24 hour parking so of course I stayed with the Roosevel Valet and am very happy with my decision. I've noticed in all the reviews that the guests that have complained have all booked via resellers (ie; Priceline). Maybe the lesson for them is, booked direct with the hotel if you want the best service? If I was the Management in the Hotel I would also bump those who did not book directly with the Hotel. I will absolutely return again, the location was wonderful, and the hotel was easy to access from the highway. The only thing that I have to say that is that the elevators were slow (1 was broken) and the only ice/beverage machines were on the 2nd floor but that certainly wont keep me from going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place !”
Reviews.Author: Pao65
Reviews.Content: Booked here for one night to visit Seattle. Had read mixed reviews . Gave it a try and dont regret it. The first and immediate impression was a positive one. We were welcomed by a man at the reception named Peter . He deserves a mention : Kind, extremely helpful and a very nice person . I travel extensively and doesnt happen often to bump into people like that. Room was extremely well furnished, care for details, very comfortable bed, breathtaking view, spotless , silent and comfortable. Location , for our needs , was perfect. Close to everything and not more than a ( pleasant ) 8/10 minute walk to the Marina . I will definetely return to the Roosevelt

Reviews.Title: “Hated it, terrible owner, lame staff Bates' Motel owns this place”
Reviews.Author: S1rAl3x
Reviews.Content: These people like to dictate the prices of their rooms according to the availability of other places to stay in downtown Seatte and how busy the weekend might be. As stated by others this has also happend to them, it does not matter if you planned your trip 1 month or 1 year in advance , nor does it matter how far you traveled, flew, etc. They actually erased my post since it was so negative on their official website, smart guys don't want anyone telling the truth especially when it's directly linked the your official .com site. I'm sure there are plenty of less poorly ran places to stay without money hungry owners in Seattle. Great location and boy do they know it. This weekend Manchester United were in town playing the Seattle Sounders, it broke a record at Quest Field (seats 67,000 and the attendance was 67,052) at least Quest Field could squeeze in 52 more. "The Roosevelt" or as i like to call it "the George Bush Jr. Administration, or The Obama Administration for that matter, decided to not make one attempt to call, email, and we flew.... instead decided, in a dwindling economy, to take advantage of that super busy weekend and told us, "Sorry some people decided to stay over in your room" Seriously.?? Well when Quest field sells out and there is nowhere to stay perhaps $400 a night is enough to let people "stay over" in our booked room, this is the only time ever i've had a hotel do this and i've stayed in hotels all over California, Vegas, England wherever. The manager had some poor kid behind the desk who was shaking as he told us. What class to not even be able to face people in your own establishment and let some college kid take the heat, well done. I told them i'd rather stay with Courtney Love than this place and i was serious......steer clear unless you want them to relocate you as they did us in a dump hotel 10 miles back out towards the airport. Oh it's all good tho we got a "free limo ride" to this place and a courtesy shuttle bus to take us 10 miles into and back out of Seattle each time tipping the driver who was a nice guy but was not on time as in an hour late to pick us up at 11pm after the game, after walking 3 miles to our shuttle bus pickup at Krispy Kreme donuts. These people screwed us over royally and the owner should learn a lesson or eventually one will be taught P.S. class stuff to take down all of your reviews that directly connect to the official.com website your hotel in Seattle is linked to. Since there are Roosevelt hotels all the way to the east coast im sure my family and i were just a bug in your windshield, and thanks for the positive memories i'll bring back from our totally gratifying experience. This rant is the best way i can tell you people how upset my family and i were. US Dept of Labor need to run court on the owner ASAP and if your reading this btw as im sure an owner might don't be suprised if you see a fist comming towards your peephole next time you order room service.

Reviews.Title: “Beware -Zero stars”
Reviews.Author: reddevils10
Reviews.Content: We arrived on the 19th of July to see a Manchester United Soccer Match with the Seattle Sounders. We choose this hotel because of its location. When we arrived we were dropped off by our shuttle from the airport only to be told by the hotel they had people that had stayed over and they would have to send us to the Nexus Hotel -9 miles out!!!! We had made this reservation and paid for it 3 1/2 months earlier. I ask why they just simply didnt tell them the rooms were already taken. They offerred no answer. We were tired from flying and finally getting nowhere, we stayed at the Nexus, which by the way looks like it was built in the 1950. Very unprofessional and we are going to dispute the charges and file further complaints. This just isnt right!!!!!!!!!!!! Please let all your friends and family know even if you have a reservation number that doesnt mean you have a room with them.

Reviews.Title: “Horrific customer service”
Reviews.Author: tjemte
Reviews.Content: We never actually stayed. The customer service was so horrible when trying to make reservations that we decided to cancel our stay. The front desk rep - Porcia - hung up on me because I didn't understand when she said once the date I wanted was open, and in the next breath she said they were sold out. I telephoned the manager and he was patronizing at best. I wrote to the hotel execs and never received an answer. Very poor customer service. I've vowed not to stay at Coast Hotels again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and nice hotel.. we'd stay again”
Reviews.Author: Stacey07w
Reviews.Content: Read all the reviews and was pleased that it was all that everyone said.. The staff was very friendly. Our room was large.. the only complaint I have (which is why i gave it 4 instead of 5 stars) is the bathroom was tiny. There was no room to put my makeup, curling iron, really anything. There was a small shelf and no counter.. But it worked out they had a mirror in the living room area I got ready in. The location was amazing. The parking was alittle high so we found a park lot a few blocks (howell St) that was half the price. You don't need a car unless you plan on going outside of Seattle which we did for a whale watching tour. All and all a nice hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Good Price”
Reviews.Author: Mbuti
Reviews.Content: We were 2 couples staying at The Roosevelt Hotel last week. Staff was VERY efficient and friendly. Rooms were spacious with nice sitting area. Could use a little updating (e.g. some stains on bathroom walls, ceiling, etc.) - but overall a nice stay. And the beds were VERY comfortable. Great big screen TV! And the location was fantastic - centrally located in downtown...walking distance from Pike Place Market, Capitol Hill, shopping, restaurants, breweries, etc... And the Link Light Rail (city transit train) stop is merely a block away. It's an "older style" hotel - but it certainly served its purpose - and made for an enjoyable stay in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kelcarib
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 rooms for 1 night at each end of our cruise. The rooms were good sized, we even had a pullout in one though we had not requested it. One complaint is the beds are higher in the middle, so you find yourself fighting to not roll toward the edge all night. Otherwise rooms were clean (sure there's a bit of mildew in corners of bathroom, just don't touch it) and adequate. We stayed on 16th floor first go round and had good views, but 6th floor on return was of a building, but we did not care since we were in/out in a day. The front desk was always professional and pleasant. The check in gal did make a point of saying when we checking in "ah, I see you have booked through XXXX" and even though she did eventually honor our request to check in early (while other guests were going up to their rooms already at 11 am) we had to wait until after 1. Maybe they do those rooms last, but whatever, she did not make us wait til 4 and we thanked her for that. They were great about keeping our bags while we toured Seattle on our return from cruise at 10 am and they did put us all on the same floor. They also arranged for reasonable/dependable transport to airport. The hotel is very elegant and warm, the Van's restaurant is very close seating (always getting bumped in the back) with small chairs and is very loud at times. Food was so so. The continental breakfast is adequate and is value priced at $9.95, we balked at first but came back when we realized it was a bargain considering the other local choices and it does include bacon, eggs, sausages etc. which we did not realize at first either. We would go back and do recommend it as an affordable hotel in Seattle, hint: we booked months ahead through discounter and the price never went down to that again even days before. Also, they evidently were overbooked since I did overhear the desk clerk stating that she had just received a booking through another discounter that they would have to "walk" since they had to rooms for those dates. She voiced that a "manager had not locked out the system properly" and that was the reason for the error. So those folks would arrive and be told there's no room at the inn. I think the lesson here is to book early through discounters, and be prepared to relocate if you book late--oh and always confirm even though the discounter will say it is not necessary, I am glad I did, we had no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy, tiny bathroom, no alternate room offered.”
Reviews.Author: mystydawnwaters
Reviews.Content: Fairly old hotel with some aspects renewed, but some important ones not. Old windows do little to keep out the very noisy vibrations from the huge HVAC on the building across the street. All noises can be heard from neighboring bathrooms (faucets turning on and off, razor being tapped on sink...). Not any surface big enough to put a toilet bag next to the sink. Absolutely not the quality I would expect on a business trip in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “We were here 2 times within a week and had 2 different experiences”
Reviews.Author: Aging_well
Reviews.Content: Our first night we didn't get in until afte 1am and had tonleave at 6 am. We were put in a hole that barely had room for a fullbsize bed. No bathtub, just a shower. Very noisy. I think a heat pump was outside our window on roof. The room was reserved by a 3rd party. The next week, we were here for 2 nights and I made the reservation. We had a larger room with a queen bed, bath tub and good view. Still not spacious, but good quality. With the location and price along with fact we weren't here much as were were touring, I would recommend this place. Very clean both times.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the Center of Downtown Seattle - I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: pmccunn
Reviews.Content: Best location in downtown Seattle. It is two blocks from the Link which gets you to the airport for $2.75. Also only 2 blocks from the Monorail. Got us to our play at Seattle Center in 5 minutes. Felt safe getting from the monorail to the hotel at 10:30 pm. Great shopping all around as well as restaurants. Cheescake Factory directly across the street as well as a Barnes & Noble Bookstore. The room was immaculate and we felt like we'd been upgraded or given the best room in the hotel although we had not paid extra. Hotel has high security elevator (room key operated) Signs advise you to keep your door dead bolted as well as the security bar in place. Probably a reason for this.... I though I heard a small knock at our door. I didn't answer the door or peer out. Just ignored it since we were in for the night. Probably should have called the desk about it....

Reviews.Title: “Simple, but good experience”
Reviews.Author: Kristin F
Reviews.Content: Good value for the money and great location. I was surprised at how spacious my room was. Desk was not that great, so I'm glad I didn't have to do a lot of work there. Nice flat screen TV and beds & linens are updated. The bathroom is quite small, but the hotel has maximized storage space so it's still functional. My only complaint is that my room rate - booked through an agency - was supposed to include a food & beverage coupon. I asked someone at the front desk about this twice, they both promised to talk to the manager, and not a single person ever got back to me during my 3 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beware -- Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: jager96
Reviews.Content: I would give it zero stars if I could. When we arrived after our cruise to check in we were told they had move stay overs than expected and that they had no room for us. They had not attempted to contact us before our arrival. They moved us to a hotel that was several miles away in the university district and told us to walk next door to a shopping center to catch a shuttle to that hotel. They didn't even provide transportation. It took us over 40 minutes just to deal with the situation at the Roosevelt plus the shuttle ride, plus the check in process at the new hotel. It took us over 90 minutes just to check into a hotel room, that wasn't the one we wanted! We booked the hotel specifically because of it's location in downtown, which we were no no where near. Once we got to the other hotel, there were continued issues and the entire day was filled with stress and frustration. I would never stay at this hotel or any other Coast hotel ever again. And we were not alone. I watched them turn away at least 5 other groups while we were standing there waiting. Beware!

Reviews.Title: “A1 for amenities and location!”
Reviews.Author: SandraD08
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, which is the least of it's attributes. The bed was incredibly comfortable, better than home! Great ambience combined with friendly helpful staff made this a must return destination.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Inkblotspot
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel we stayed in during our latest North American trip, and we were really happy with it. The Roosevelt has a great old world feel, with beautiful wallpapers and furniture to match. The staff are friendly and obliging, and the room was very clean. We stayed in a Deluxe Room, which I'm pretty sure is the smallest they offer - but for travel it was a perfect size. The best thing about the Roosevelt is its location to Downtown Seattle. It was by far the most convenient hotel we stayed at on our trip - easy to duck back to the hotel for a mid afternoon break, and safe enough to wander home at 2am after a long dinner and drinks. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Roosevelt Rocks”
Reviews.Author: tamale56
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 5/27 and loved it. Great room, good rate and close to everything. We stayed in room 705, a corner suite with a king bed. You can't beat this place. Great if you are staying over for a show at the Moore or Paramount, or for shopping, sightseeing. Clean and comfortable and the staff is great. Lots of good restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ColbertGD
Reviews.Content: Great location for downtown, very comfortable bed, nicely appointed room, small bathroom but not a problem for me

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: 2nunk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a quick overnight visit to Seattle. We encountered some problem with our room being ready for us at check-in time (almost an hour after check-in time of 4), but the hotel staff was extremely apologetic and went out of their way to "fix" the situation and make sure we were satisfied. This is not a 5 star hotel as far as amenities, but the location alone makes it very worthwhile for a Seattle stay. The short walk to all shops, restaurants and Westlake stop was perfect for our short trip! The room was very small but clean. The bathroom was also tiny but had what we needed- a clean sink, toilet and shower/tub combo. Wi-Fi was free. Flat screen TV w/movie channels. AC was on the noisy side but worked well which was more important. For the rate we paid (under $150) we found it to be well worth the value and would stay here again for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...that's about it- I would not stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Keleeisenhauer
Reviews.Content: We did not enjoy our stay, nor were our issues resolved. Our toilet did not flush properly during the entire stay...it was disgusting. I actually had to use the bathroom in the hotel restaurant and go across the street to the mall to just use a restroom. The hotels response was that this happens because it is an old building and to call them when it happens. How embarrassing to call to have your toilet unplugged after every use! This was their best solution even after asking to change rooms to which I never even received a response to my request. Upon checkout, the manager said thank you for bringing it to his attention & engineering will fix it...that sure didn't make my stay any better, nor did it show me that the manager had any sort of empathy for our situation. The other issue was a yippy dog in the room next to us...how annoying...again, I complained but got no response. Hair in the bathroom too-ewww! I would not recommend this hotel, as I know you can get a better value & experience elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Jacuzzi Suite was a nightmare...should have taken a clue from the front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: kellips
Reviews.Content: The Jacuzzi Suite was a complete joke. Nice big bed, but the part thats supposed to be the kicker, The Jacuzzi, was absolutely Filthy! Before I even ran the water, I could see tons of random pubic hair covering the tub floor. It was everywhere, even the tub walls and ledge! I don't know about you, but my idea of a relaxing evening doesn't include cleaning massive amounts of strangers Pubic Hair out of a bathtub. I used 3 rags to clean it out as I did plan to at least shower...but when I wiped across the side of the tub and shower tile, the once white hand-towel, turned a brownish yellow color. Maybe the Roosevelt isnt as nice as I had built it up to be. But I guess I cant say I was completely shocked, as my introduction to the Roosevelt should have been a clear indication of the experience I was walking into... First off, when I called to make my reservation, the gentleman at the front desk was beyond rude. His name was Christian, which I duly noted as I was completely taken back by his disrespectful tone and overall snobby attitude. He sighed throughout the entire conversation as he was taking my personal information and placing it in the computer. In short, he sounded like he had a million other things he would rather be doing instead of assisting me. Which is Completely fine...Unless you're in the business of hospitality! Then you might need to fake your way through it here and there :-) After our uncomfortable but speedy 4 minute conversation, (which consisted of providing room availability and price)...Christian unenthusiastically says " ok, we'll see you this week" I quickly stop him before he hangs up on me and ask..."Wait...ummm what time is check in?" He scoffs, as if I just asked him to recite the alphabet backwards and snaps: "it's at 4:00 o'clock!" Well, thanks Christian, I'm so excited to meet you! You sounds like a lovely individual! Then...god forbid...I attempt to ask Christian one more question about my reservation (bad idea)... He responds with: "look, I'm really busy right now, So you can either call back or I'm going to have to put you on hold again!" In my head Im thinking: What? Why are you so mad? I know there are those annoying folks out there that will keep you on the phone for hours asking you to detail the most ridiculous, insignificant information...but I'm not one of those people...So whats with the attitude?! Never mind...I'll just google it. In short, what I experienced over the phone with staff and later as a paying guest, was completely unacceptable and extremely disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Successful meeting started with a great stay”
Reviews.Author: Rocfish
Reviews.Content: If you're planning a sales meeting, the Roosevelt is the place to stay. Great location, walking distance to Pikes Place Market, and restaurants. We had 25 people stay here and the rooms were great, but the meeting accomodations were even better. We had a personal asssitant with the hotel to help us with any technology and food and drink. Very impressed with the friendly staff and accomodations. This hotel has a buzz that led to a great envirnment for our meeting. Highly recommend you have your meetings here. Areas Sales Manager

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: plap8
Reviews.Content: We came down to Seattle from Vancouver for the weekend. The concierge at the hotel was very helpful in arranging a great tour of the city and Puget Sound. Pike's Market and great shopping were within easy wallking distance from the hotel. The room did not have a view but was very attractive and comfortable. Wi Fi was not free in the room but was available for free in the lobby which had plenty of seating and complimentarly coffee in in the morning. We loved the bar at the hotel and went there for a bit each night. Our favorite discoveries in dining were the Cheesecake Factory across the street as well as Pike's Chowder and the Pink Door found in the market's alley's. Serious Pie had delicious pizza and was also walking distance in a different direction. We also enjoyed some great brews at Pike's Pub near the market. We found the hotel to be excellent accomodation for the purpose of our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: DraperyDude
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, excellent staff. I was a little worried when I booked it because the photos on the site had the rooms looking REALLY outdated, but again for the price and location I could not pass it up. Rooms were excellent and had been updated a bit from what was shown on the website.

Reviews.Title: “AC is too noisy. The card key sucks. Staff made mistake.”
Reviews.Author: qqq39
Reviews.Content: Basically, the room is clean and nice but the AC is too noisy. We can also hear voices from the next room, very loud. The worst part was the card key which supposes to operate the elevator and open room door often went down. During our 5-day staying, we have changed our card keys three times. Other guests also had the same problem. Another thing I'd like to complain is that I asked the front desk to book a Boeing Tour for me. However, the front desk booked me to a company that is different with the brochure I showed them without consulting with me first. This mistake not only cost me more money ($11 difference) but also separated me from my friends who went on with another company.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding In Every Way”
Reviews.Author: rpsteele
Reviews.Content: Wife and I do an annual December trip to Seattle to take in shopping, shows, food, and the city Christmas vibe. Usually stay at the Sheraton, which is no slouch, but saw a special at the Roosevelt for Jacuzzi View Suite. About $50 less than the Sheraton regular room, so had to give it a go. Have always been aware of the Roosevelt and have knocked back more than a couple of martini's at Von's over the years but first time staying there. Awesome, professional, and polite staff; from valet to conceriage to front desk to cleaning staff. The lobby way elegant and decked out with Christmas decorations. Reeks of old school charm you can only find in the older hotels. In spite of concerns from previous reviews, the elevators were fine. The room was huge. His/her robes and slippers. Lot's of stuff other than shampoo and conditioner including bath salts for the jacuzzi. Room was on the northwest corner of the building so had two walls with windows offering natural light. A great view of the city, including the Macy's star. The only complaint would be how much on-street activity I could hear. Especially when the bars closed and you could hear lots of hollering and shouting. I though the window was open. I suspect this is simply because the age of the building and it is not insulated for sound like newer construction. All in all, a 5 star experience. We will return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, charming, easy parking and friendly valet”
Reviews.Author: sunandfun155
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights during a business trip to Seattle. Read all the complaints about the elevator, but did not have any problems with it. Both elevators were working and were fast. Recommend the valet parking as it is reasonably priced and they bring your car very quickly. Room was charming and fairly clean - only complaint was there was a large greasy hand print on the outside of the window, which was there during my entire stay. Quiet hotel but the HVAC was very loud and made the walls/headboard vibrate when on. Had to sleep with it off. Also windows that open means poor sound insulation from the streets. Concierge and valet were very friendly. Could have used a refrigerator in the room for the left-overs from the yummy restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Proximity to Everything”
Reviews.Author: DopeyNGrumpy
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a fantastic part of downton Seattle. It was close to eveything, especially Pike Place Market...our favorite part of downtown Seattle. The hotel would have had a perfect five, except the second elevator never worked. The first night it took us twenty minutes, before we could get to our room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Joey83
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights before a cruise and it was perfect for what we needed which was great location, clean, safe, nice rooms and not too expensive...well it was lt was all those things:) Steps from everythign you would want to see in Seattle, the only further thing was the Space Needle and that was just a case of hopping on the monorail too. Literally doors from the Cheescake Factory....YUM! Room was big, comfy and quiet, city view and clean bathroom. It clearly states that the water is not complimentary and so not confusion. Only slight annoyance was the lift was not working properly so you either have to use the steps or call for a manual operator, not really a hige problem just a point to make.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was great up until it was time to leave”
Reviews.Author: terifficeagle
Reviews.Content: From the time I arrived, I received superb service from the front desk. When I needed directions, the young man at the desk was always available to give accurate directions and provide a map. The day before I left, I was told by the friendly young man that when I needed my cab to call downstairs 5-10 minutes before. So the next morning, I called the front desk at 4:23 AM (I wanted a cab by 4:30 for my 6 AM flight). The guy at the front desk told me to call back 5-10 minutes before I was ready. I told him that's what I was doing, it's 4:23 and I'd like a cab by 4:30. My whole thinking was that I was calling 5-10 mins before I was going to head down. So then the front desk guy had an attitude, said that I needed to call back because he wasn't going to call the cab company because he's not going to watch for cabs that pull up in front of the hotel, "that's not my job, I'm not going to be responsible if the cab leaves". All I could think was how rude this guy was. I smiled, and hung up the phone. I called back down when I was literally walking out the door. When I reached downstairs, I was ready to tell the guy how rude and unprofessional he was over the phone, and he was not there at the front desk. I got in the cab and went to the airport. I just feel that there is a more polite way to deal with guests. I would hate to give this hotel a p!ss poor rating for one rude employee, so I'd still recommend it, I just ask the hotel front desk (in particular the young man who works the overnight shift) to learn some manners and etiquette when dealing with customers if you want return business.

Reviews.Title: “Location is Key”
Reviews.Author: rxbecca22
Reviews.Content: Reading the previous reviews did help to appropriately set our expectations. Yes the elevator is slow, and yes the rooms are smaller than what we typically expect now. I will say that the room was comfortable for 2 adults, but would be cramped if you're a family of 3+. If you these are minor things to you, then you're stay will be great. The perks were the location (6 blocks straight down from the market). The shopping is a block or two away as well. Also, the Westlake Center (light-rail train and buses) is 2 blocks away, which gets you anywhere you want to go ... including a $2.50 trip from the airport. Also, the room was clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. Internet is free, but only available in the lobby (not in the room). If you want luxury, this is not your hotel ... but if you're going for a cheaper alternative that's downtown this is a good option for you. Also of note, Von's Restaurant connected with the hotel is great for dinner/drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Ask about elevator before you book! Check in is at 4 PM, none earlier”
Reviews.Author: MadisonGrog
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3-night stay at Roosevelt. First of all, the staff was cordial and friendly uniformly. They tried their best with a tough situation. The place was down to one smallish elevator. Because this place is popular with cruise folks with lots of luggage, this meant LONG waits during rush periods. I would not book a room until all elevators are working. Second, my cable TV did not work most of the time. They would fix it; then it would go out. I was there on business so -- apart from the World Cup Final -- this was no big deal. However, if you were there with kids..... Good things about hotel: Staff; location (near Convention center, Westlake -- where airport train comes in, and Pike St. Market), price is high but this is downtown Seattle. Vonn's restaurant next door has Sunday buffet brunch for $10. It is nothing special but worth the $10. (Excellent bacon...) My room was a little stodgy but clean and quiet. AC worked well. Free Wi Fi in lobby + one public computer there; pay wi fi in rooms. Nice big TV but cable didn't work well. Bad? Elevator (being repaired) and check in time. Bad cable TV. One ice machine on 3rd floor. If you are big ice person, this could be a pain. I didn't care. I didn't have a car so I can't comment on parking although it seemed to be right next door. I came from airport on Grey Line Shuttle ($15) and was dropped right across the street. And I took light rail train back to airport (short walk over to Westlake from Roosevelt); long walk at airport through most of parking garage to terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Rons1961
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Roosevelt 7/2-7/4 and it is a nice hotel, not plush by any means but comfortable with a friendly staff and clean rooms. Does seem like they do have their "Price Line" rooms as when I called to confirm, they mentioned Price Line and we would be getting a single bed. It was a single queen on the 16th floor the only down side was there were elevator problems and at most times only one of the two elevators were working. It is a great location, easy walk to Pike Place Market and right next door to the shopping district. It also is across the street from the subway that can take you to and from the airport. Next door is Von's it has a great selection of spirits and beers, did not try the food but it looked good from what we saw. Over all this is a great place to stay, would not be worth paying full price though and would recommend that you do the discount path.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, kind of blah room”
Reviews.Author: HolidayRoad
Reviews.Content: We booked our room through the Victoria Clipper, not knowing where to stay in Seattle. The location was awesome; the room was blah and spartan and the hotel really didn't have the character I was expecting. On the upside: It was clean and we slept well. It's an older hotel and it feels like a well-kept older hotel. No problems with noise from other rooms. It was an awesome location, and for that reason I recommend it. One elevator was being worked on when we were there, which they warned us about at check-in, and thus it never really bothered us.

Reviews.Title: “One elevator for 20+ floors for the past 4 months”
Reviews.Author: imissyou012
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. There's the one star. The service is very below average at best. From the Expedia reviews, I knew that one of the two elevators were not working in April and May. It is now July and only ONE of two elevators are working. I asked them why did it take over 4 months to fix one elevator and their excuse was that they are "renovating" the "other one". Oh please. They don't even have a sign that ONE elevator is working on any of the floors. It's like they want to hide the fact that it hasn't been working for 1/3 of the year already. One elevator for 20+ floors is ridiculous. You share the elevator with any and all hotel staff and wait 10-20 minutes for it (not knowing why unless you asked since there are no signs or apologies on any elevator!). I think the worst was when BF and I were told that we booked two queen (more like full) beds by the manager, Alicia. She was the worst. She told us to our face that we booked the two queens when we booked the one king bed. I asked her for proof, a print screen, anything that supported her statement that us, a couple, would book two queen beds and instead she told us to call priceline ourselves. She is the worst hotel "manager" I've ever encountered. Her young minion that looked like he was 12 was similar. He told us to go book a hotel elsewhere and good luck finding one on Fourth of July weekend. I will never be staying here and I highly advise that everyone avoid the lack of professionalism and service, hotel management all under the age of 25 and who act like it and one working elevator for 20+ floors. Very rude and obnoxious. The non-apologetic behavior re the elevator and how they screwed us on our reservation was the worst. Avoid at all costs!

Reviews.Title: “Love love it”
Reviews.Author: wow2much
Reviews.Content: As you walk into The Roosevelt Hotel, you know you are going to be pleased with the accommodations. The front desk staff were very friendly. The conceirge was very helpful and had a great sense of humor. The atmosphere of the lobby is so relaxing. You can just sit in the lobby and admire the decor. It didn't matter that they were only operating on one elevator (due to maintenance). We were in no rush to get anywhere. Our room was absolutely gorgeous. We didn't have the best view but then again we were not in our room during the daytime to enjoy. The location was perfect, centrally located to many amenities like the Pike's Public Market, First Avenue, the Monorail, Barnes and Nobles just a step away from our front door, the Westlake Shopping Mall, had a free service transit system from certain points (which made it so convenient when we got tired) and had plenty of street entertainment. We played tourist and shopped until we literally dropped. Priceline.com did well for us. The only thing that might be useful was an in-room fridge.

Reviews.Title: “You can't beat the location of this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mrozin
Reviews.Content: We, too, got an excellent deal on our stay here, and were suprised to receive such a spacious and comfy room. We did not want to use a car while we were in Seattle, and were able to walk or easily catch a bus to anywhere we wanted to go in the city. Being located close to an airport light rail station is a big plus. There are more than enough restaurants and shops within a few blocks...and you can find plenty of restaurants with great Happy Hour food & drink deals,too. Yes, only one elevator was working, but it didn't ruin our stay. Usually TV reception isn't something I pay attention to because there are too many other things to do than watch TV on vacation. However, we had reception problems and it was only an issue because it affected watching World Cup!
